Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MK58911 (a peptide analog from the mastoparan class of wasps)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.31867293] Fungi:C. neoformans (MIC = 31.2 μg/mL), C. gattii (MIC = 15.6 μg/mL), P. brasiliensis (MIC = 7.8 μg/mL), P. lutzii (MIC = 15.6 μg/mL)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.31867293]MK58911 was not toxic in lung fibroblasts (MRC5) and glioblastoma cells (U87) at tested concentrations, and a high IC50 of >500 μg/mL was observed in both mammalian cells.
Sequence Information.Comments: MK58911 is not toxic in two mammalian cells (lung fibroblasts and glioblastoma cells) and in the G. mellonella model and demonstrates both in vitro and in vivo antifungal efficacy. Moreover, the peptide acted on the membrane of fungal cells and induced necrosis.

Literature.Title: Antifungal Activity, Toxicity, and Membranolytic Action of a Mastoparan Analog Peptide
Literature.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2019 Dec 6;9419. doi 10.3389/fcimb.2019.00419. eCollection 2019.
Literature.Author: Singulani JL, Galeane MC, Ramos MD, Gomes PC, Dos Santos CT, de Souza BM, Palma MS, Fusco Almeida AM, Mendes Giannini MJS.

Literature.Title: Structure-activity relationship of mastoparan analogs: Effects of the number and positioning of Lys residues on secondary structure, interaction with membrane-mimetic systems and biological activity
Literature.Author: Souza BM, Cabrera MP, Gomes PC, Dias nB, Stabeli RG, Leite nB, neto JR, Palma MS
